info.description: This is API documentation for the Labelprint System API. The API provides endpoints for adjusting label data and publishing news. The API requires authentication using a Bearer token. The API is hosted at `dev.wacoa.jp`.
info.title: Labelprint System API

get.description:
This endpoint receives a GET request with a user ID as a query parameter,
verifies the authentication token, and fetches the adjustment data
associated with the user ID from `adjust_service`.

Query Parameters:
- user_id (str): The ID of the user for whom adjustment data is requested.

Headers:
- Authorization (str): Bearer token to authenticate the user.

Returns:

- 200 OK: JSON response with the adjustment data if retrieval is successful.
- 401 Unauthorized: JSON error message if the authorization token is
missing or invalid.
- 500 Internal Server Error: JSON error message with details if an
unexpected error occurs.

parameters.description: Bearer token to authenticate the user.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The ID of the user for whom adjustment data is requested.
parameters.name: user_id

401.description: Unauthorized – Missing or invalid authorization token.

get.summary: Retrieves adjustment label data for a specified user.

post.description:
This endpoint receives a POST request with adjustment data and saves it
using `adjust_service.store_adjust_details` after verifying the
authorization token.

Headers:
- Authorization (str): Bearer token to authenticate the user.

Returns:

- 200 OK: JSON response with stored data if the operation is successful.
- 401 Unauthorized: JSON error message if the authorization token
is missing or invalid.
- 500 Internal Server Error: JSON error message with details if an
unexpected error occurs.

parameters.description: Bearer token to authenticate the user.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The JSON payload containing the adjustment data.
parameters.name: body

401.description: Unauthorized – Missing or invalid authorization token.

post.summary: Stores adjustment label data in the database.

post.description:
This route accepts a JSON object containing user credentials and returns a token
along with the user record if the authentication is successful.

Request Body:
- JSON object containing:
- 'login_id' (str): The ID of the user attempting to log in.
- 'password' (str): The password of the user attempting to log in.

Responses:
- 200 OK: Returns a successful login response including:
- 'message' (str): A success message.
- 'user_record' (dict): A dictionary containing user details.
- 'Authorization' (str): A Bearer token for authenticated requests.

- 401 Unauthorized: Returns an error response if the credentials are invalid.

- 500 Internal Server Error: Returns an error response if an unexpected error occurs during the authentication process.

Returns:
Response: A response object with the appropriate status code and JSON payload.

Raises:
Exception: If an unexpected error occurs during the password update process.

parameters.description: The JSON payload containing the login data.
parameters.name: body

post.summary: Authenticates a user and logs them in.

post.description:
This endpoint handles the POST request for user logout. It retrieves the user's authentication
token from the request headers, verifies the token, and calls the `user_logout` method to
remove the token from the user's record in Firestore.

Request Headers:
Authorization (str): The user's authentication token, typically in the format 'Bearer '.

Request Body:
dict: A JSON object containing the user information required for logout, including:
- user_id (str): The ID of the user attempting to log out.

Returns:
dict: A JSON object containing the response message or error message.
int: An HTTP status code indicating the result of the operation:
- 200 if the logout is successful.
- 500 if an internal server error occurs during processing.

parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating the user.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The JSON payload containing the user information for logout.
parameters.name: body

details.example: An unexpected error occurred during logout.

500.description: Internal Server Error – Unexpected error during logout.

post.summary: Logs out a user by removing their authentication token from the server.

post.description:
This endpoint handles the password reset process by accepting a JSON payload
containing user identification and new password information. It processes the
request and returns an appropriate response indicating the outcome of the
password reset attempt.

Args:
data (dict): A dictionary containing the following keys:
- 'user_id' (str): The ID of the user whose password is to be reset.
- 'new_password' (str): The new password to set for the user.
- 'confirm_password' (str): Confirmation of the new password to ensure
both entries match.

Returns:
Response: A JSON response with a message indicating the success
or failure of the operation, along with an appropriate
HTTP status code.

parameters.description: The JSON payload containing user ID and new password information.
parameters.name: body

400.description: Bad Request – If the passwords do not match or other validation fails.

details.example: An unexpected error occurred during the password reset process.

500.description: Internal Server Error – Unexpected error during password reset.

post.summary: Reset the password for a user.

post.description:
This endpoint allows a logged-in user to update their password. It verifies the
user's authorization token, processes the password update request, and returns
the appropriate response based on the success or failure of the operation.

Request Headers:
- Authorization (str): Bearer token for authenticating the user.

Request Body:
dict: A JSON object containing:
- 'shinsei_user_id' (str): The ID of the user whose password is to be updated.
- 'current_password' (str): The user's current password for verification.
- 'new_password' (str): The new password to be set.
- 'confirm_password' (str): A confirmation of the new password.
- 'password_hint' (str): An optional hint for the new password.


Response: A Flask response object containing:

- int: HTTP status code indicating the result of the operation:
- 200 if the password is successfully updated.
- 401 if the authorization token is invalid.
- 500 if an internal server error occurs during processing.
Returns:
- dict: A response dictionary which can include:
- 'message' (str): A success message if the password update is successful.
- 'error' (str): An error message if the update fails.

Raises:
Exception: If an unexpected error occurs during the password update process.

parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating the user.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The JSON payload containing the new password data.
parameters.name: body

details.example: An unexpected error occurred while updating the password.

post.description:
This route handles POST requests containing a login ID. It retrieves the login ID from the request data,
invokes the `user_reset_password_link` method to generate and send a password reset link to the user's email,
and returns the appropriate response to the client.

Request Format:
- JSON object containing the following field:
- LOGIN_ID (str): The login ID of the user requesting the password reset.

Returns:
Response: A JSON response containing:
- Success message or error details, depending on the operation's outcome.
- HTTP status code indicating the result:
- 200 if the email with the reset link is sent successfully.
- 500 if an internal server error occurs during processing.

parameters.description: The JSON payload containing the login ID for password reset.
parameters.name: body

details.example: An unexpected error occurred while sending the reset link.

500.description: Internal Server Error – Unexpected error during password reset.

post.summary: Endpoint to initiate a password reset process by sending a reset link to the user's email.
